description: [Burness Communications] It is interesting to see, from my vantage point in South Africa, the reaction to the slight rise in tuberculosis (TB) cases in the U.S. Overall, TB in the U.S. has declined steadily since the early 1950s. But in the past few years, TB incidence has started to slowly increase. While the percentages seem steep, the overall increase is  less than 1,300 new cases .
title: Africa: In Africa, We Finally Have Momentum Against TB. Let's Not Squander It

description: [Daily Maverick] A new report finds that a transition from diesel to battery-powered electric buses in South Africa's main cities can be justified purely on a financial basis, in most circumstances.️
title: Africa: Cheaper Down the Road - Total Cost of E-Buses Beats Diesel in the Long Run in South Africa - Study

description: [The Conversation Africa] South Africa's government is calling for public comments on an updated version of its existing biodiversity economy plan.
title: Africa: South Africa's Conservation Model - Why Expanding the Use of Biodiversity to Generate Money Is a Good Idea

description: [GhanaToday] Ghana has been ranked the 1st West African country by the World Economics Research based in London, the United Kingdom. Ghana gained 61.7 points on the World Economics Governance Index.
title: Africa: Ghana Ranks 1st in West Africa, 5th in Africa On World Economics Governance Index

description: [Daily Maverick] The new wealth platform will be headquartered in the UAE, the Middle East's financial hub, providing access to advanced budgeting, savings and investment solutions for users in the Middle East, Africa and southeast Asia regions.
title: Africa: Standard Chartered, Old Mutual Fintech Arms to Launch UAE Wealth Management Platform
